newsitem.title: USA: NY precious metals called to open mixed.
newsitem.headline: NY precious metals called to open mixed.

text.p: COMEX and NYMEX precious metals futures were seen opening mixed on Friday.

Gold was slightly stronger in London on the weaker dollar, and the weak equities market in the U.S. The platinum group metals (PGMs) were higher on TOCOM, supported by the strike at Impala Platinum Holdings
COMEX December gold was seen opening unchanged to up 50 cents an ounce from Thursday's close of $325.80, after trading a $325.00-$326.50 range in overnight ACCESS trade.
The spot bullion price was $322.25/75, up from the London early gold fix, which was $321.60 an ounce.
COMEX warehouse stocks increased 2 ounces Thursday to 944,793 ounces, while COMEX silver stocks declined 56,578 ounces to 169,624,870 ounces.
COMEX September silver was seen opening unchanged to 0.50 cents lower from Thursday's close at $4.375 an ounce.
NYMEX October platinum was expected to open down $5.00 to $7.00 an ounce from the previous close at $432.60.
NYMEX September palladium was seen opening down $4.00 to $5.00 an ounce also from the previous close at $215.60.
TOCOM palladium finished limit-up on heavy technical short covering, despite reports that Russian metal is arriving in Japanese ports.
